review_title: Work/life balance a priority at CMA
pros: Great benefits and perks, work/life balance a priority at CMA, awesome culture, engaging, excellent CEO, lots of opportunities for development, and the people who make a difference!

cons: Toxic work environment. Most of upper management have been there for decades and have formed clicks which is the main fuel source of a toxic work environnent. Small company so very little opportunity for advancement. The cma is notorious for layoffs so staff feel the need to work unpaid overtime in order to sooth their perpetual fear of being laid off. This is where the work life balance and ability to work from home 100% of the time is of benefit to management and a detriment to staff as it makes it very easy to lay off staff when there is no emotional attachment to coworkers and employees. Because of cons listed above, there is absolutely zero work culture. All in person events are awkward because majority of staff are uninterested in socializing with their colleagues.

review_title: CMA provides all the tools for a healthy work/life balance, to be productive and excel.
pros: The Work/Life Balance, Culture and Values, Respect for Employees, and genuine concern for their well-being create a productive work environment. There is a comprehensive onboarding program and regular personal and professional development opportunities. Excellent benefits.
cons: Not a big company so not a lot of opportunity for advancement.

pros: The CMA is a great organization. They treat their employees with the utmost care, and are a compassionate; especially within the HR department. More pros: Flexible work environment Competitive PTO Competitive salaries Positive staff and management
cons: The organization has undergone significant change in the last year + and individuals need to be flexible to deal with those changes, and deal with the ambiguity.

pros: Friendly work environment, great remote working policy
cons: Not a lot to do as a student, limited supervision

pros: Interesting subject matter involving people's lives
cons: Toxic workplace, Arbitrary management. Too many approvals required. Frequent reorgs where people have to re-apply for their jobs.

pros: I enjoy helping the patients to receive the best care possible, booking the ultrasound,mammograms bmd's asap so patients,can get there results rapidly ,plus walk-in xrays. The radiologist & office staff extremely pleasant to work with.
cons: This company bought CML imaging. Unfortunately one of the owners doesn't have a clue what to do or give directive to is staff. And very derogatory towards women.

review_title: Dynamic work environment with great people
pros:
There's a variety of projects, which in a way are interconnected and help advocate for Canadian physicians and for Canadians receiving health care.

Along with the dynamic and variety of work, there are lots of great people to work with and supportive management team who cares about employee wellbeing.
cons: Downside is that sometimes the CMA's work can be misconstrued as a way to enhance the "CMA brand" instead of objectively advocating for the benefit of association members, patients and public.

pros: At the CMA you work with highly engaged and talented individuals and teams. Teamwork is fostered in an ever changing environment that embraces new ideas.  I feel privileged to be part of it!
cons: There is little movement; people rarely leave because they love it here.

pros:
- CMA is more than just a workplace, it's a family
- Great CEO, who is very approachable and cares about his employees
- Great mission and vision
- Provides competitive salaries and benefits
- Flexible work environment
cons:
- Heavy on senior management 
- Smaller organization, might have limited advancement opportunities depending on position

review_title: Miss my time at the CMA, honestly
pros: Great pay, good benefits. Job was rewarding and I worked with great people.
cons:
Poor communication across teams and can be very high-stress, which was almost ways unnecessary stress. 
CMA's subsidiary Joule is a mess and caused a lot of extra issues.

review_title: CMA is a great place to work!
pros: Flex benefits, competitive salaries, flexible work arrangements, pension plan, challenging and meaningful work, LEED Gold status building, approachable CEO, great perks, great people.
cons: Lack of promotions/upward movement within the organization.

pros: Great benefits; engaging and motivating work; super CEO - has great vision and deeply care for our members; sense of pride; collaboration.
cons: Lack of opportunities to move upward within organization.

review_title: I’ve never experienced toxic work culture like this
pros: The Benefits are good, that’s all I have to say.
cons: The membership service team is run like a cult and breeds toxic masogenistic, racist, homophobic culture. I am told the rest of the organization is different but how they allow this group to operate in this way. I’ve seen people cry from traumatic interactions with senior team members.

review_title: Good company to work at. Great people
pros: - The environment is great to work in. Agile, bold, innovative.
cons: - There are days where work is less busy and you have to actively seek out projects

pros: - Forward looking CEO and organization, interesting  topics/issues, great work life balance, good benefits.
The work/life balance and happiness of the employee are taken seriously.
cons: Hard to move up in the company.
